meanings.sent1: She was oversanguine about passing the test, even though she didn't study much.
meanings.sent2: His oversanguine belief that everything would work out perfectly often led to disappointment.
meanings.sent3: Despite the storm clouds gathering, he remained oversanguine about having a picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her oversanguine attitude was like wearing rose-colored glasses in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The oversanguine plan to finish the project in one day seemed impossible.

meanings.definition: Showing an unrealistic expectation of success.
meanings.sent1: The oversanguine entrepreneur believed his business would become a million-dollar company overnight.
meanings.sent2: Their oversanguine approach to the competition made them underestimate the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent3: The oversanguine actor thought he would win an Oscar for his first movie role.
meanings.sent4: His oversanguine dreams of becoming a famous singer crashed when reality hit.
meanings.sent5: The oversanguine plan to climb the mountain without proper gear was a recipe for disaster.
